Dave Astels wrote:
> I think a randomizing test runner would be neat... it would run
> the tests in a random order each time.  it would uncover order
> dependencies pretty quickly I think.  I don't recall noticing such a
> thing.  Have I jsut not looked carefully enough?  Or should I write one?
>

You bring up an interesting point about uncovering dependencies. There is
merit to the idea of a separate "look for dependencies" test case that runs
a set of tests in a *predetermined* sequence of alternate orderings. The
reason I say predetermined is that randomness is generally a bad thing,
unless that randomness is repeatable. In general that goes for all random
data values as well. It's better to generate and capture a set of random
values for repeated use or start with the same seed, than to generate new
random values each time.
